lps.pr2
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  lps.pr2.Game

public class Game
extends java.lang.Object

This class is responsible for controlling the main loop of the interactive adventure. It creates the rooms and the parser and runs the main loop until the user has arrived at an exit room.

Field Summary
protected  Room _currentRoom
          Room where the player stays
protected  Command _history
          Last executed command
protected  Parser _parser
          The parser responsible for interpreting the user instructions
protected  Inventory _playerInventory
          The player inventory
protected  boolean _quitFlag
          The flag that decides when the game has finished.

Method Detail

init

public boolean init(java.io.InputStream in,
                    java.io.OutputStream out)
Initializes the game, creating the rooms and the parser

Parameters:
in - The inputstream where the user writes the commands
out - The outputstream where the game prints the messages during the game
Returns:
true if the game was initialized without errors

runGame

public void runGame()
Main loop of the game

endGame

protected void endGame()
Prints the information when the game has finished

describeRoom

public void describeRoom()
Prints the description of the current room on the outputstream

changeRoom

public boolean changeRoom(Parser.Direction d)
Changes the current room according to the given direction.

If there is a wall in this direction, then a warning message is printed.

If we have changed the room, then the game prints the room description.

Parameters:
d - The direction we want to walk to.
Returns:
true if we have arrived at the exit. False, otherwise.

initMap

public boolean initMap()
Creates the rooms contained in the map, sets the initial room where the player is going to start the game and prints the room description.

Returns:
true if there was no problems during the initialization.

False, otherwise.

createRooms

protected Room createRooms()
Creates all the rooms contained in the map

Returns:
The room where the player starts the game

requestQuit

public void requestQuit()
This method is employed by the commands that have to invoke the end of the game

undo

public void undo()
Undoes the last command executed (if any). After that, it cleans the command history

getCurrentRoom

public Room getCurrentRoom()
Returns the current room where the player stays

Returns:
the current room
